fields.title: Just maybe
fields.content:
Maybe your tomorrow is yesterday

Maybe your light is darkness

Maybe your sun rises from the West and East is sets

Maybe your moon shines during day

Maybe you read your books from the back

And upside down you readeth

From right towards left your hand sketches

Maybe your pen's run out

Maybe you had luck,bad luck anyway ðŸ˜«

Maybe your doors were closed,no, locked infact.

Maybe your North is south Your sky, earth instead

Maybe your right is wrong And your  garment inside out.

But all along,it was first class.

Perhaps you should go back and start?

Maybe. A possibility.

fields.title: One Day.....
fields.content:
One day we will  wake up, we will smile
One day we will right our wrongs,we will predict it wisely.
One day we will sing happy melodies
One day we will write from the left to the right
We will read our books from the front
We will hold our books uprightly.
One day we will wear our garments not inside out.
One day our north will be south and south north
One day the sun will rise.
From the East,and West it will set.
One day our doors will be closed,not locked, will open.
Our pens shall refill and our books will bulge more leaves,we will rewrite our story.
A story of smile,hope and faith..
One day we will tell our story afresh,perhaps with more confidence
It will be a good day indeed.
Good days are yonder.

fields.title: Love from a shattered heart
fields.bio: With Love from a shattered heart
fields.content:
How have you been lately...
Breaks my heart, that we no longer talk heavily,sad now hastily.
Long ropes draw tonnes of love from the depths of my heart.
To find you but your love's shallow and so I'm hurt.
Stressed heavily.
Not to be playing you my harp.
Not to be gliding into your dms,and consuming your electronic love.
And when one time you respond, it's just a laugh.
Well two roads for me.
Much loads for me to choose. Left and Right.
Which one did you choose?
With my left hand I pledge to right my wrongs.
Even without your thongs I will sing you songs.
Will you listen?
Will you even? Tell me,was that the last drop?
Or shall I bring my game on top?
Is our Love one way now?
But how?
How have you been lately?
LillyðŸ¥²

fields.title: Which Way
fields.content:
It was the best of the times,it was the worst of the times.
It was a time of wisdom,it was a time of foolishness.
It was a time of believe, it was a time of doubt.
It was a time of marvelous light,it was a time of extreme darkness.
It was a time of downfalls,it was a time of rising.
A season of merry, a season of grief.
A summer of hope,a winter of despair.
It was a time of birth,it was a time of death.
It was time of flying,it was time of landing.
A time of laughing,a time of crying.
It was a time of peace,it was a time of war.
It was time of learning,it was time of oblivion.
North became South,and West East.
The Sun, from the West it came, dozed off to the East.
But even in this tumult,we smiled through.
And looked at the far light, however dim.
However far it may seem.

fields.title: If we part ways....
fields.bio: If we part ways....we will meet again
fields.content:
And if we part ways.
And if we forget each other.
And if we don't talk.
To you I'll walk.
And if the Love dies.
I'll walk to the skies.
Pray.
Pray that I will get a bigger shade for you.
That the Sun will not torture you again.
Pray that I will get more water.
That your throat will not run dry.
Just pray, don't cry.
And if again our paths don't cross.
I will consider it a loss 
And if again we don't talk.
Just know it was never a joke.
Pray that we will see our faces again.
Pray these phases shall pass.
I pray that you will not become a prey.
I pray that we'll see things in one light.
We will  again make things right.
That we'll drink from the same cup...no cap.
And I will put on your hat,cuz you have my heart.
Pray that we will meet again.

fields.title: Lilly
fields.bio: With Love from the depths of a shattered heart
fields.content:
To me I see you in two lights.
First,
You are the like Lilly Anyamvua in the legendary Chozi la Heri who was in love with Mwangeka. Just for death to snatch her away.
You died when you didn't reply my text, you died when you didn't pick up my call,you died when you declined my meet up
Yet I didn't read your eulogy.
Second.
Like the destructive weed on the banks of Lake Victoria,you invaded my heart, leaving no chamber untouched.
But you left it hollow, null,void and dark.
Yet no human uprooted you but you were nowhere.
You disappeared when you didn't reply my text, when you didn't answer my call, when you, when you declined my meet up.
You just wanted to breathe though.
